Name: Statuette of an Actor
Description: The statuette of light green faience depicts an obese man with a fat belly, flabby chest, and deformed genitals. He wears a short dress similar to the clothes of the simple commoners. His feet are bare and his face is covered with a comic mask. The statue could be that of a slave from the greek New Comedy. The left hand and some of the fingers of the right hand were broken and are now missing.
